block.p: Linda Debra Werbel, a daughter of Paulette and Stephen Werbel of Merrick, N.Y., was married on Monday to Lowell Dashefsky, a son of Nadine and Donald Dashefsky of Roslyn, N.Y. Justice Bruce Alpert of State Supreme Court in Mineola, officiated at Temple Israel in Lawrence, N.Y. Rabbi Samuel Sandhaus, a cousin of the bride, performed the religious ceremony.

Linda Debra Werbel, a daughter of Paulette and Stephen Werbel of Merrick, N.Y., was married on Monday to Lowell Dashefsky, a son of Nadine and Donald Dashefsky of Roslyn, N.Y. Justice Bruce Alpert of State Supreme Court in Mineola, officiated at Temple Israel in Lawrence, N.Y. Rabbi Samuel Sandhaus, a cousin of the bride, performed the religious ceremony.

The bride, a graduate of the University of Michigan, and the bridegroom, who graduated cum laude from Union College in Schenectady, N.Y., received law degrees from the Brooklyn Law School, where they met. The bride, 28, is an associate counsel in the city legislative affairs unit of the mayor's office. The bridegroom, 29, is an associate at Fish & Neave, a New York law firm.
